qas.question: When was the minority leader position created?
Why was minority leader position created?

answers.text: not always evident who functioned as the opposition floor leader

qas.question: Who is sometimes considered the first funcioning "Minority Leader?"
Who was Treasury Secretary at time of first congress?
From what time do scholars like to study the affairs of congress?
What state was Alexander Hamilton originally from?
What system was created by Alexander Hamilton?
How long did Alexander Hamilton serve as Treasury Secretary?
What did Alexander Hamilton function as to oppose James Madison?

context: To a large extent, the minority leader's position is a <a0_0><b4_0>20th-century<b4_0/><a0_0/> innovation. Prior to this time congressional parties were often relatively disorganized, so it was <a1_0>not always evident who functioned as the opposition floor leader<a1_0/>. <b7_0>Decades<b7_0/> went by before anything like the modern <b6_0>two-party<b6_0/> congressional system emerged on Capitol Hill with official titles for those who were its official leaders. However, from the beginning days of Congress, various House members intermittently assumed the role of "opposition leader." Some scholars suggest that Representative <a2_0>James Madison<a2_0/> of <b5_0>Virginia<b5_0/> informally functioned as <b8_0>the first "minority leader"<b8_0/> because in the First Congress he led the opposition to Treasury Secretary <a3_0>Alexander Hamilton<a3_0/>'s fiscal policies.
